senses.de: To do, carry out a task or action.
senses.ex: He will perform the task by tomorrow.

Tips.title: Task Oriented
Tips.description: Use 'perform' when discussing completion of specific tasks, focusing on the action.
Tips.example: The magician will perform his act tonight.

Tips.title: Active Voice
Tips.description: 'Perform' fits well in active voice, emphasizing the subject doing the action.
Tips.example: Our team performs routine checks daily.

senses.de: To act or present on stage or screen.
senses.ex: She will perform the lead role in the play.

Tips.title: Stage Presence
Tips.description: 'Perform' in theatre implies a live audience and an element of entertainment.
Tips.example: The comedian performed to a full house.

Tips.title: Artistic Expression
Tips.description: In arts, 'perform' often involves expressing emotion or character through action.
Tips.example: He performs with great passion and intensity.

Tips.title: Scripted Action
Tips.description: 'Perform' in drama suggests following a script or choreography, unlike improvised acts.
Tips.example: She performed her monologue exactly as rehearsed.

senses.de: To achieve, produce or result in something.
senses.ex: The system performs well under pressure.

Tips.title: Efficiency Matters
Tips.description: In technology, 'perform' is used when discussing how well something works or functions.
Tips.example: The new software performs calculations in seconds.

Tips.title: Result Focus
Tips.description: Use 'perform' when the outcome or result of the action is important.
Tips.example: This technique performs better in laboratory tests.

senses.de: To work, operate or function properly.
senses.ex: My car performs well on the highway.

Tips.title: Operational Quality
Tips.description: When 'perform' describes function, it's about quality or effectiveness.
Tips.example: Her new laptop performs exceptionally well.

Tips.title: Mechanical Context
Tips.description: 'Perform' in mechanical contexts implies reliability or expected function.
Tips.example: Does this engine perform well in cold weather?

Accomplish.wordDefinition:
Accomplish means to successfully complete or achieve a goal or task.

Accomplish refers to successfully completing a goal or task, while perform refers to carrying out a task in front of others, usually involving a certain skill or talent.

Carry out.wordDefinition:
The words carry out and perform are both verbs that refer to completing an action, but they are used in slightly different ways.

Carry out often refers to completing a task or action that has been assigned or planned. For example, you might say "I need to carry out the instructions my boss gave me" or "Let's carry out the plan we discussed." It implies that someone else has given you a task or plan to complete.

Carry out is used when referring to completing a task or plan that has been assigned, while perform is used when referring to completing a task or action that requires skill or talent.

Complete.wordDefinition:
Complete means to finish or accomplish a task or activity. It is applicable when you have a task or assignment to do and you want to indicate that you finished it.

For example, "I completed my homework" means that you finished all the tasks given to you.

Discharge.wordDefinition:
Discharge means to complete a duty or responsibility. For example, a doctor discharges their duty by caring for their patients.

Discharge is used when talking about responsibilities or duties, while perform is used when talking about tasks or actions.

Do.wordDefinition:
Do is a general verb that means to carry out an action or task.

It can be used in any situation where an action is taking place, such as "I need to do my homework" or "I'll do the dishes after dinner."

Do can be used in any situation where an action is taking place, while perform is typically used in professional or formal situations where a task or activity is being carried out with a high level of skill or precision.

Enact.wordDefinition:
Enact means to make a law or a rule, while perform means to carry out an action or a task. Enact is used when someone is making a law or rule, like when a government passes a new law.

Enact is used when creating rules or laws, while perform is used when doing tasks or actions.

Execute.wordDefinition:
Execute means to carry out a specific task, plan or order. It's usually used in formal or professional settings where a procedure or task has to be completed with precision or accuracy.

For example, a surgeon performs an operation, but an engineer executes a project.

The difference between the two is that execute is more formal and refers to carrying out a specific plan or order with expertise, while perform has a broader meaning and can refer to both artistic expression and everyday tasks.

Fulfil.wordDefinition:
Both words imply the completion of a task or duty, but fulfil is associated with meeting a specific expectation or obligation, whereas perform primarily refers to executing a task or action.

For example, when someone fulfils their promise, it means they have met the expectations or conditions set by that promise.

In short: fulfil applies to meeting expectations, while perform applies to carrying out an action or task.

Operate.wordDefinition:
Both operate and perform refer to carrying out a task or activity, but the context and specific meaning can differ.

Operate typically refers to using machinery, equipment or a system in order to make it work as intended. For example, a person might operate a crane to lift heavy objects or operate a computer to run software.

Operate refers more so to using specific equipment or systems while perform has a broader range of applications and can relate to achieving a goal or displaying a skill.

Undertake.wordDefinition:
Undertake means to take on a task or responsibility that may be challenging, complicated or difficult. Undertaking can involve planning, researching, and preparing before starting the task.

Perform refers to carrying out a task that is already known, while undertake refers to taking on a task that may be unknown, but one is willing to learn and try their best to complete.

quotes.Text: I just knew that was what I wanted to do. I was going to perform as a singer; I was going to perform as a dancer, and I was, you know, going to do movies and be an actress. I was going to do it or die trying. That's what my life was.
quotes.Title: American Musician
quotes.Name: Jennifer Lopez

quotes.Text: The quality of Indian players is very high. They need to show motivation to perform at the highest level.
quotes.Title: Brazilian Footballer
quotes.Name: Roberto Carlos

quotes.Text: Work controls my life, writing controls my life, performing controls my life.
quotes.Title: American Poet
quotes.Name: Lemon Andersen

quotes.Text: It's very rare and unusual to see a female comic perform pregnant.
quotes.Title: American Actress
quotes.Name: Ali Wong

quotes.Text: Life does not measure up to performing... Performing is perfect.
quotes.Title: American Comedian
quotes.Name: Joan Rivers

quotes.Text: I feel the most centered in my life when I'm performing a song.
quotes.Title: American Musician
quotes.Name: Ruston Kelly

quotes.Text: The EPA has performed a very important role for us all.
quotes.Title: American Politician
quotes.Name: Scott Pruitt

quotes.Text: No matter what, I'm being paid to perform.
quotes.Title: Canadian Baseball Player
quotes.Name: Joey Votto

quotes.Text: Performing has always been my passion.
quotes.Title: American Wrestler
quotes.Name: Scarlett Bordeaux

quotes.Text: I've been performing my whole life.
quotes.Title: Canadian Musician
quotes.Name: Shania Twain
